conclusion: Consider conditions for total internal reflection (TIR) in the optical fiber.
Total internal reflection occurs when light in a medium with a higher refractive index hits a boundary with a lower refractive index at an angle greater than the critical angle.
Identify the critical angle for total internal reflection: sin(θ_c) = 1/N.
Determine the angle of incidence at the outer surface of the fiber related to the radius of curvature r and the diameter D.
Relate the angle of incidence to the geometry of the fiber using trigonometry: sin(θ_i) = D/(2r).
Set the condition for total internal reflection: sin(θ_i) ≥ sin(θ_c).
Substitute the expressions for sin(θ_i) and sin(θ_c): D/(2r) ≥ 1/N.
Solve for the minimum turning radius r: r ≥ ND/2.
